org.smpp.debug

Interface Debug

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultDebug, FileDebug, LoggerDebug

    public interface Debug
    The interface Debug is an interface to application specific debug information trace facility. Users of the SMPP library can either use one of the two implementations of the Debug interface -- DefaultDebug or FileDebug or they can implement their own class or create an adapter to their legacy trace facility. The SMPP library's root class, SmppObject contains object of type Debug so that all descendants of the SmppObject class can write trace lines.
    The interface contains methods to write lines of trace information and also support functions to structure the written information according function call nesting. Morover, the users can group their tracing code to groups according functional areas and turn on and of these areas.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    DefaultDebug, FileDebug, SmppObject, SmppObject.setDebug(Debug), SmppObject.getDebug()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      Activate the tracing, whatever it means.
      void activate(int group)
      Activate the tracing in specified group.
      boolean active(int group)
      Returns if the given group is active.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivate the tracing, whatever it means.
      void deactivate(int group)
      Deactivate the tracing in specified group.
      void enter(int group, Object from, String name)
      Used to enter tracing in the function in the class if the provided group is turned on.
      void enter(Object from, String name)
      Used to always enter tracing in the function in the class.
      void exit(int group, Object from)
      Used to exit tracing in the function in the class if the provided group is turned on.

      Used to exit tracing in the function in the class.

      void write(String msg)

    • Method Detail

      • enter

        void enter(int group,
           Object from,
           String name)
        Used to enter tracing in the function in the class if the provided group is turned on. Entering usually means that the trace lines indentation increases and the lines get new prefix based on the name of the class and the name of the function.

      • enter

        void enter(Object from,
           String name)
        Used to always enter tracing in the function in the class. Entering usually means that the trace lines indentation increases and the lines get new prefix based on the name of the class and the name of the function.

      • write

        void write(int group,
           String msg)
        Used to write a line of trace if the provided group is turned on.

      • write

        void write(String msg)
        Used to always write a line of trace.

      • exit

        void exit(int group,
          Object from)
        Used to exit tracing in the function in the class if the provided group is turned on. Exiting usually means that the trace lines indentation decreases and the prefix of lines is restored to the value set before call to the corresponding enter.

      • exit

        void exit(Object from)
        Used to exit tracing in the function in the class. Exiting usually means that the trace lines indentation decreases and the prefix of lines is restored to the value set before call to the corresponding enter.

      • activate

        void activate()
        Activate the tracing, whatever it means.

      • activate

        void activate(int group)
        Activate the tracing in specified group.

      • deactivate

        void deactivate()
        Deactivate the tracing, whatever it means.

      • deactivate

        void deactivate(int group)
        Deactivate the tracing in specified group.

      • active

        boolean active(int group)
        Returns if the given group is active.
